TopicTitle: Let's Lag Kerbal space Program Thread

Articles.Content:
Figured I'd start a thread for my Ksp youtube series

Here's the link: http://www.youtube.com/user/Annon1125

Will post every new video here, to keep you guys up to date

Don't Forget to like subscribe and comment
At first I thought this was going to be about intentionally making the game lag, IE, building rockets with lots of parts, looks good though!
I enjoy how "play" is substituted for "lag", lol. Nice vid!

At first I thought this was going to be about intentionally making the game lag, IE, building rockets with lots of parts, looks good though!

My game takes almost 7' to load, I don't need rockets with a lot of part to make it lag
Load time is not the same as lag.
I originally called it Let's Lag due to the the fact that my CPU has about as much power as an ant engine ,and as a result I get about 8 to 20 FPS while recording and even less on the carrier lol

I agree macintux ,although my load times are quite bad also

Edited April 27, 2013 by annon_1125

I enjoy how "play" is substituted for "lag", lol. Nice vid!

Thanks if you enjoy the videos don't forget to like, comment and subscribe.

The more you do the more feedback I get and the better videos I can make for you.

Load time is not the same as lag.

Well, if you want something else One second in game is about 5 seconds IRL even with low part count vessels. Is it what you call lag ?

Well, if you want something else One second in game is about 5 seconds IRL even with low part count vessels. Is it what you call lag ?

not exactly in my case lag refers to the amount of Frames Per Second the game runs at, something between 30 to 60 Frames per Second (FPS) is considered normal, drop bellow 30 however and I consider the game to be lagging, this is because bellow 30 FPS you start to see visual choppiness which reduces your reaction times due to the cpu or gpu of ur computer skipping frames in order to keep up. This is generally referred to as FPS drop or Lag.

Load time is not the same as lag.

Neither is bad framerate. Somehow the colloquial term for network latency issues has come to mean "anything wrong with anything, anywhere." Like that time my car got all laggy on the way to work, I had to pull over and put on the spare tire. Or that time my grandfather died of a laggy liver. I hate lag.

not exactly in my case lag refers to the amount of Frames Per Second the game runs at, something between 30 to 60 Frames per Second (FPS) is considered normal, drop bellow 30 however and I consider the game to be lagging, this is because bellow 30 FPS you start to see visual choppiness which reduces your reaction times due to the cpu or gpu of ur computer skipping frames in order to keep up. This is generally referred to as FPS drop or Lag.

Considering I have one second latency between the moment I hit the key for the RCS for example and the moment when it actually happen, I think it could be considered as "lag"
